title: Citi Turns Off Lights in 2,063 Facilities During Earth Hour 2012
summary: New York - For the sixth consecutive year, Citi showed its support for environmental sustainability by participating in Earth Hour, a global initiative designed to raise awareness for environmental protection. tag-1: Citi Turns Off Lights in 2,063 Facilities During Earth Hour 2012
tag-2: New York – For the sixth consecutive year, Citi showed its support for environmental sustainability by participating in Earth Hour, a global initiative designed to raise awareness for environmental protection. The company turned off lights in a record 2,063 of its 12,000+ office facilities and branches worldwide during Earth Hour 2012, held on Saturday, March 31, at 8:30 p.m.
tag-3: "The number of sites we had participating in Earth Hour this year shows how important environmentally friendly initiatives are to Citi employees," said Steven Avadek, Global Director of Sustainability. "We had locations in 933 cities and 68 countries taking part, and we more than doubled the number of sites that participated last year. We will continue to look for creative ways to make our operations more environmentally sustainable, to engage and inspire our employees, and to help raise awareness for climate change."
tag-4: Citi's Realty Services group coordinated and mobilized Citi's Earth Hour participation. Earth Hour began in Sydney, Australia, in 2007, and Citi had more than 50 locations registered to participate that year. Last year, Citi's Earth Hour participation grew to 738 sites in 64 countries. This year, Citi sites in Bangkok, Thailand; Beijing, China; Guadalajara, México; and Calgary, Canada, were among those that switched off their lights.
tag-5: Citi, which celebrates its 200th anniversary in June, was one of the first global financial services companies to publicly join the fight to slow climate change and reduce energy dependence. It has been recognized for its green efforts by Newsweek Magazine, the Dow Jones Sustainability Index, IDG's Computerworld, The Banker magazine and others. This month, Bank Technology News named Citi one of four of America's greenest banks.
tag-6: More information about Citi's environmental efforts is available at http://www.citigroup.com/citi/about/global_citizenship.html.
